metadata.title: CVE-2022-2977 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel implementation of proxied virtualizedTPM devices. On a system where virtualized TPM devices are configured (thisis not the default) a local attacker can create a use-after-free and createa situation where it may be possible to escalate privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
